triples.name: Statistical Machine Translation
triples.relevance: The paper builds upon existing phrase-based statistical machine translation systems to improve translation probability estimation.

triples.name: Artificial Neural Network
triples.relevance: Neural networks are used as the core technique to learn translation probabilities directly from phrase pairs using continuous representations.

triples.name: Machine Translation
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the task of automatic translation between languages using neural probability estimation.

triples.name: Moses (Machine Translation)
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates integration with the Moses decoder, a widely-used statistical machine translation system.

triples.name: BLEU
triples.relevance: BLEU score is used to evaluate the quality of translations produced by the proposed approach on English/French tasks.

triples.name: Word2vec
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using continuous space representations for phrase pairs, relating to embedding-based techniques like word2vec.

triples.name: Speech Translation
triples.relevance: The IWSLT evaluation task involves spoken language translation benchmarking.
